results.title: The Story of making the film 'They're a weird mob'
results.brief_description: Shows some aspects of the work relating to the production of the feature film, “They’re a Weird Mob”. Gives information on the main actors, the writer and producer, and also extracts from earlier films. Discusses the importance of this production and the outlook for Australian feature films. Narrated by Ed Devereaux.

results.title: The Story of Long John
results.creator_credit: Campbell Harper Films and Alan Harper
results.brief_description: A film about the establishment of a new Long John Scotch Whisky at Tormore in the Scottish Highlands - the first completely-built distillery in the highlands in the 20th century. Workers’ homes and the distillery were designed to fit in with the landscape. Tormore was chosen because of its water quality. The process of distilling and blending is also featured.

results.title: The Story of locomotive haulage in the present age
results.creator_credit: Big Six Film Unit and Edward Cook
results.brief_description: The story of the Huwood Hudswell diesel mine locomotive. Shows various features, its uses of special man-riding cars for speedy transport of miners to coal face; effect of new transport system; speedier output, larger loads and increased coal production.

results.title: The Story of little Tattian
results.creator_credit: Sakura Motion Pictures and Michiharu Aoyama
results.brief_description: The escapades of a five-year-old in a Japanese family. Based on a story by a well-known Japanese juvenile writer and financed by a women’s group interested in producing good films for children. Little Tattian plays pranks on his brother and sister, presents his grandmother with his box of `treasures’ (bees’ wings, buttons and the likes), leaves his brother at the market and hides at home while others frantically search for him, and indulges in elaborate fantasies of bogeymen. Cast: Takahide Funazu, Yoshonori Tanaka, Yukiko Ibuki, Kumeke Urabe, Tony Tani, Setsuko Sinobu.

results.title: The Story of Holmesglen Concrete Housing Project
results.creator_credit: Housing Commission of Victoria and Herschells Films
results.brief_description: The Housing Commission of Victoria has a huge project at Holmesglen, a suburb of Melbourne, for the manufacture of prefabricated houses. All components of a modern house or a block of flats are constructed at this factory and transported in bulk to the place of erection. Concrete walls, chimneys, fences, tiles for roofs, plumbing units, wooden door cupboards and other fittings are all shown under construction and are then shown being fitted into place as the house is erected. Credit is given to the research work being carried out by the CSIRO Building Research Division, particularly in regard to a new type of light weight concrete which has been developed there.
results.title_for_label: The Story of Holmesglen Concrete Housing Project

results.title: The Story of Henry Handel Richardson
results.brief_description: This animated short was highly commended in the “Create a Stamp Story” section of the Screen It! competition. Henry Handel Richardson was the pseudonym of Ethel Florence Lyndsey Richardson; this stamp story is about her achievements in music and literature. An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: The Story of H.M.S. Shannon (TEFC)
results.brief_description: A lively touch to any program, this song story describes an incident in the War of 1812. Colourful drawings give a satirical twist to the engagement between a British ship, the H.M.S. Shannon, and an American ship, the U.S.S. Chesapeake. Sung to guitar accompaniment by Canadian folksinger Tom Kines.

results.title: The Story of gin
results.brief_description: The production of gin from cereal grains - wheat, barley or maize, pure water, and aromatic herbs. Shows four main stages - the cleaning and grinding of the grain; cooking and fermentation with the addition of malt and yeast; distillation of gin by adding juniper berries and other exotic herbs. Bottling, sealing and labelling completes the process. Shows constant quality control tests.

results.title: The Story of fine china
results.brief_description: The history of pottery, china and earthenware, leading up to the achievements of Josiah Spode and showing present-day manufacturing methods which have changed very little in 150 years.

results.title: The story of fashion. Vol. 3: The Age of dissent
results.creator_credit: Roberta Guerra, Eila Hershon and RM Arts
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Phaidon art collection”.
In the third of this three part series, Karl Lagerfeld as presenter discusses the history of fashion in the 20th Century focussing on ‘The age of dissent’, the 60’s and beyond. Lagerfeld enlightens with commentary the archival footage of fashions from the last forty years with interviews of respected seniors of the industry such as; Ralph Lauren, Issy Miyaki, Mary Quant, Ballenciaga, John Crancher, Georgio Armani, Ralph Lauren and more. In emphasis is the shift from a controlled environment to one that defines the day of ‘anything goes’. Explored is the change in attitude toward the making, showing and promotion of fashion since the sixties, a change that has developed from social conditions and lifestyle. From the ultimate dissent of ‘Punk’ to the sleek and subtle work of Jean Muir, this program celebrates design in a time where the lines between art and fashion have blurred and an increase of cultural exchange has fashioned a diffusion of styles.
